answers.answer: How do you already know you will need to be induced if you are only 13 weeks??
Im high risk diabetic and was already told by my high risk doctor.  I just won't know an exact date till july

Some women go from not dilated at all to delivering within a few hours. So don't assume you'll have to be induced (even if you've scheduled it with your doctor) just because you haven't dilated yet.Sometimes doctors choose to manually dilate, which is more natural than something like cervadil. Cervadil is a pill inserted inside your vagina to help you soften up and dilate. A bulb or balloon is inserted instead sometimes which slowly inflates to help you dilate and falls out I think when you reach a six.Those methods can be painful to insert but typically lead to natural labours. Sometimes though, the Dr will decide to start a pitocen drip in addition to what you already have. In this case, the pitocen can cause contractions far stronger than natural labor, which also leads to it being more painful. If this is given to you, ask if you can have the drip turned off when you reach a certain dilation to see if your labor will continue on its own. If so, great! If not, it's not too hard to start the drip up again.

Im hoping to be able to do it without being induced I really want an all natural birth. And I'm not sure what kind of induction technique this doctor uses. So thank you hopefully baby will come before the induction but not to early

I was induced n it weren't bad. I didn't need an epidural just the I.v meds but they run out after a couple of hours. It was okay for me. I fear going into labor on my own. I am high risk to but we haven't discussed being induced yet.

My dr told me at our first visit at 7w I was gonna be induced but he had to wait till my anatomy ultrasound in july to make an exact date and I freaked out on him. I don't want to be induced at all. But because of preexisting diabetes I have to be induced at 39 weeks.  He won't allow me to go farther then that. Im hoping my little bean helps me out in this one

Don't stress too much. My friend is scheduled for a c-section at 38w due to her having 2 previous c-sections and her scarring is pretty bad so she could rupture if she stays pregnant longer than that.Your Dr knows best and will have yours and baby's best interests in mind.

question: Ok so im only starting out in this but I was told I was going to be induced at 39 weeks.  (Im at 13 weeks).I was just really curious on the different types of induction there is.
title: induction question
